snippet: A new poll from Pew Research Center find that expectations for when young adults should be financially independent have gotten laxer over the years.
abstract: A new poll from Pew Research Center find that expectations for when young adults should be financially independent have gotten laxer over the years.
lead_paragraph: Apparently there is some truth to that stereotype of today's 20-somethings being stuck in an extended adolescence -- but if so, it seems to be mostly their own parents' doing.

headline.main: Paying Your Own Bills at Age 22
